Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation and Additional Finding
Type
Allegation On 4/10/25, a youth was becoming unruly and trying to irritate a
staff member. The youth took a blanket and tried to smack the
staff in the face with it. The staff member pushed the youth with an
open hand on the neck and chest against the wall for seconds.
Investigation Allegation
Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 04/11/2025. Complainant did
not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 04/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A stated there was no incident on
04/10/2025 between him and Staff 2 but there was an incident
between him and Staff 1. Incident with Staff 1 is addressed below
in Additional Finding of this rule.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 05/01/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 2 stated he relieved a staff (does not recall who)
and started talking with Youth A, who was the only youth on Unit
1D on 04/10/2025. Staff 2 stated this was his first time working
with Youth A. Staff 2 stated Youth A asked for his pen and he told
Youth A that he could write it down for Youth A. Staff 2 stated
Youth A ignored his offer and said, “Let me see if I’m gonna take
it”. Staff 2 stated Youth A made verbal threats to punch him. Staff
2 stated he redirected Youth A when Youth A approached him.
Staff 2 stated Youth A swung a blanket and it connected with Staff
2’s face. Staff 2 stated he was shocked and put his arms in front
of him to maintain a distance from Youth A. Staff 2 stated his hand
connected with Youth A’s upper chest by his neck and he took
Youth A to the wall. Staff 2 stated he stepped back when Youth A
said, “Get your hands off me”. Staff 2 stated master control called
for assistance, assistance arrived, and the incident ended. Staff 2
stated he was then moved to another unit and Supervisor
remained on the unit.
Video
Highlights from 4/10/2025 Unit 1D video on or around 5:48 PM
shows Youth A and Staff 2 walking around the unit. Youth A has a
blanket draped over his shoulders. Staff 2 places his arms out in
front of him as Youth A makes boxing gestures with his fists and
approaches Staff 2. Youth A swings his blanket and it connects
2

with Staff 2’s face. Staff 2’s left hand connects with Youth A’s
upper chest near the base of Youth A’s neck and Staff 2’s right
hand is on Youth A’s left forearm. Youth A’s backside is pushed
against the wall. Staff 1 steps away from Youth A and assistance
arrives on the unit on or around 5:49 PM.
Documentation
Staff 2 wrote an incident report that coincides with his interview.
Incident report states the incident occurred at 5:48 PM on
04/10/2025.
Staff 2 completed Handle with Care training on 01/16/2025 and
01/17/2025.
Tour
Upon entering Unit 1D one steps into the common area with the
staff desk to the left. Youth rooms line the wall opposite the
entrance door. The common area has a table with attached stools,
couches and a television. Incident between Youth A and Staff 2
occur in the common area against the wall with the youth rooms.
Additional Finding
Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 04/11/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A stated he did not want Staff 1 working
Unit 1D for no particular reason. Youth A stated he started to play
around by trying to punch or push Staff 1’s arm. Youth A stated he
went into his room and retrieved a pair of underwear, which he
brought out and waved around in the common area. Youth A
stated he swung his underwear and it hit Staff 1. Youth A stated
Staff 1 redirected Youth A to stop waving his underwear at her but
he did not comply until she called for assistance. Youth A denied
being physically managed or injured by Staff 1 in this incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 05/01/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with Union Representative. Staff 1 stated 04/10/2025
was her first time working with Youth A. Staff 1 stated the shift
started off without issue but Youth A’s behavior “flipped like a
switch”. Staff 1 stated Youth A requested to see a nurse for a
blood sugar check because he had headache. Staff 1 stated
Youth A ate dinner and balled up some of his food to slide under
Unit 1D’s entrance door, which has approximately an inch gap
between the bottom of the door and the ground. Staff 1 stated
Youth A went to his room and said he was going to throw his
underwear at her. Staff 1 stated Youth A came out of his room and
threw a pair of fecal stained underwear at her face, which
3

prompted Staff 1 to take Youth A by the front of his shirt and push
him against a door. Staff 1 stated Youth A pushed back and she
released him. Staff 1 stated supervisor (does not recall who)
responded to her assistance call and nurse came to the unit. Staff
1 stated nurse checked Youth A’s blood sugar and left the unit.
Staff 1 stated Youth A squeezed his pointer finger to draw blood
out after his blood sugar test and wiped it on Staff 1’s right hand
and her shirt. Staff 1 stated Youth A continued to taunt her by
pointing his finger at her face until assistance arrived on the unit
and the incident ended. Staff 1 stated another staff (does not
recall) who relieved her of her duties on Unit 1D with Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed on 05/08/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Supervisor stated Staff 1 was frustrated
working with Youth A and stated she did not want to work the unit.
Video
Highlights from 04/10/2025 Unit 1D video on or around 3:50 PM
shows Youth A takes the logbook from behind the staff counter
and reads it at the table in the common area. Staff 1 tries to get
the logbook from Youth A without success. Youth A soon gets up
from the table and gives the logbook to Staff 1, who is standing
behind the staff counter. Youth A receives a writing utensil from
Staff 1. Youth A reaches over the staff counter and places a
Styrofoam food container on the counter. Youth A walks to the
unit’s entrance door twice and bends down at the door. Youth A
walks to the left side of the unit and writes on the wall. Staff 1 tries
to redirect Youth A and Youth A walks to the unit’s entrance door.
On or around 3:55 PM Youth A walks into his room (room door is
open) and exits with his underwear. Youth A walks towards the
staff desk and swings his underwear several times at Staff 1. Staff
1 moves away from the staff desk. On or around 4:03 PM Staff 1
uses both hands and pushes Youth A’s backside against a door
by holding his upper arms. Staff 1 releases Youth A and uses her
walkie talkie. On or around 4:07 PM Staff 1 watches a nurse
check Youth A’s blood sugar. Youth A points his left pointer finger
towards Staff 1’s face and touches Staff 1’s right hand. On or
around 4:28 PM Supervisor is on the unit. On or around 4:30 PM
Staff 1 leaves the unit. Video does not record sound.
Documentation
Staff 1 wrote an incident report that coincides with her interview.
Incident report states incident occurred around 4:30 PM on
04/10/2025.
4

Nursing note dated 4/10/2025 states Youth A complained of
headache earlier but subsided after he ate. Youth A’s glucose was
measured. Youth A was educated about high glucose and to notify
staff if he has symptoms.
Staff 1 completed Handle with Care training on 12/11/2024 and
12/12/2024.
Tour
Upon entering Unit 1D one steps into the common area with the
staff desk to the left. Around the staff desk area are red tape lines
on the ground. Youth rooms line the wall opposite the entrance
door. The common area has a table with attached stools, couches
and a television. Incident between Youth A and Staff 1 occur in
the common area against the wall with youth rooms.
Analysis Allegation
The agency is found in noncompliance when Staff 2 pushed Youth
A against the wall on 04/10/2025.
Additional Finding
The agency is found in noncompliance when Staff 1 pushed Youth
A against the door on 04/10/2025.
CONSULTATION
• The staff desk area is clearly marked with red tape lines on
the ground to indicate a boundary. Youths should be
redirected to stay outside of the red tape lines.
• Youth A’s room door was shown open in the video. It is
recommended for room doors remain closed during waking
hours for safety and security.
• Encourage additional cleaning and sanitization when
needed.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

2025SIC0001796 Corrective action plan approved 03/03/2025

Rule Code Emergency restraint.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160
Section The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others from
an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places the
youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
Allegation Additional Finding
Investigation Interviews
Supervisor was interviewed on 05/08/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Supervisor stated Youth A threatened to hit
him with a pair of dirty underwear tucked in front of Youth A’s
underwear. Supervisor stated he attempted a primary restraint
technique on Youth A but released Youth A when Youth A pulled
himself to the ground.
Video
Highlights from 04/10/2025 Unit 1D video on or around 4:28 PM
shows Supervisor is on the unit talking with Youth A. Youth A’s
hands are made into fists at his side. Supervisor places Youth A in
a primary restraint technique and releases him when Youth A pulls
himself to the ground. Youth A pulls out a pair of underwear from
his shorts and swings it at Supervisor with Staff 1 standing nearby
watching. On or around 4:30 PM assistance arrives and the
incident ends. Video does not record sound.
Documentation
Supervisor stated he did not write an incident report because he
attempted a primary restraint technique hold on Youth A.
Supervisor completed Handle with Care training on 11/11/2024.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Physical Management policy
and procedure 10.1 states emergency restraint is used “to protect
the youth or others from an unanticipated or severely aggressive
behavior that places the youth or others at serious threat of
violence or injury if no immediate intervention occurs.” It further
states emergency restraint is used “when all other interventions in
the agency’s crisis prevention and intervention plan and youth’s
individual safety and calming plan have been utilized but fail to
protect the youth or others from unanticipated or severely
6

aggressive behavior that places the youth or others at serious
threat of violence or injury if no immediate intervention occurs.”
Tour
Upon entering Unit 1D one steps into the common area with the
staff desk to the left. Youth rooms line the opposite wall from the
entrance door. The common area has a table with attached stools,
couches and a television. Incident between Supervisor and Youth
A occur behind the staff desk area.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance when Supervisor placed
Youth A in a primary technique hold when there was no imminent
threat of violence or injury.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2025SIC0000354 Corrective action plan pending
Rule Code Program statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety
and supervision methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans and discharge of residents.
Allegation Additional Finding
Investigation Interview
Supervisor was interviewed on 05/08/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Supervisor stated he did not write an incident
report for his primary restraint technique hold of Youth A on
04/10/2025.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Incident Report Rationale
policy and procedure 6.1 states “Any event that affects the normal
operation of the Wayne County Juvenile Detention Facility should
be reported concisely and within designated timelines in order to
provide management with notice to plan or implement remedial
action, if required.” The policy states “an unusual incident is
defined as any event, which occurs outside of then [sic] normal
operations of WCJDF including but not limited to the behaviors
7

resulting in the use of Crisis Intervention, Restraint or Seclusion of
a resident.”
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance when Supervisor failed to
write an incident report on 04/10/2025 of his primary restraint
technique hold of Youth A.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
